intro: Isodon nigropunctatus, commonly known as the black-spotted verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Isodon nigropunctatus is often grown for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun.
